page.title: 17WALCOTT
page.content: WALCOTT IS ABOUT TWO MILES NORTH OF BILLINGHAY. THERE ARE ABOUT 5OO PEOPLE. THERE ARE LOTS OF OLD HOUSES AND A SMALL COUNCIL ESTATE. THERE ARE SOME MODERN BUNGALOWS. THE CHAPEL CLOSED IN 1982. THE CHURCH DEDICATED TO SAINT OSWALD BUILT IN 1851 STILL FUNCTIONS. THERE ARE TWO SMALL WORKS - SCOTT TRAILERS MAKES AND SELLS A VARIETY OF TRAILERS AND SKINNS WHO ARE BLACKSMITHS AND AGRICULTURAL ENGINEERS MENDING MACHINERY USED ON THE LAND. THERE IS A SMALL WOODEN VILLAGE HALL WHERE MOST OF THE VILLAGE EVENTS TAKE PLACE. THE VILLAGE IS SURROUNDED BY FARMS OF VARYING SIZES, MAINLY SMALL. THERE IS ONE SHOP WHICH IS ALSO THE POST OFFICE AND HAS PETROL PUMPS. THE COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL HAS ABOUT 3O CHILDREN. THERE IS A COAL MERCHANT. THE PEOPLE USE THE DOCTOR IN BILLINGHAY.
